Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, I filed Chapter XXXX. Bankruptcy. My debts were discharged in XX/XX/XXXX From XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX my student loans ( serviced by XXXX XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX XXXX University ) went into deferment. In XX/XX/XXXX, I resumed making payments on my two student loans. I have always made payments on-time, both before and after Bankruptcy. Both accounts are current and in good standing. Days of delinquency are zero. Each account is open and has a positive balance. 

Equifax credit reporting does not accurately report my student loan accounts. XXXX XXXX specifically, for example, is shown to be closed, have a XXXX balance, and discharged due to Chapter XXXX. Bankruptcy. As anyone in the debt business knows, a student loan can not be discharged due to Bankruptcy. XXXX  reports my student loan information correctly. 

Since XX/XX/XXXX, I have attempted to dispute the incorrect reporting of information on my Equifax credit report. Utilizing all of the proper dispute channels, Equifax has repeatedly come to the false conclusion that my student loan account for XXXX XXXX ( account number XXXX ) Has a balance of XXXX dollars the account has a positive balance Has a Date of 1st Delinquency the account has never been delinquent Has an Actual Payment Amount of {$0.00} the account has a positive payment amount Has a Scheduled Payment Amount of {$0.00} the account has a positive scheduled payment amount Has a Status of Account Included in Bankruptcy legally speaking, student loans can not be XXXX through Chapter XXXX Bankruptcy subsequently making Equifaxs language in the Status section overwhelmingly incorrect The remaining sections for this account on my Equifax Credit Report do not have any language, which is also incorrect. For example, as of XX/XX/XXXX the Date of Last Payment section should state XX/XX/XXXX as that was the date of my last payment for a total of {$260.00} USD. Another section left blank is the Type of Loan in which case, the type of loan is a student loan. 

Dates of Official Disputes & Dispute Confirmation Numbers 1 ) Dispute Confirmation # XXXX | Date of Dispute : XX/XX/XXXX | Date of Completion : XX/XX/XXXX 2 ) Dispute Confirmation # XXXX | Date of Dispute : XX/XX/XXXX | Date of Completion : XX/XX/XXXX 3 ) Dispute Confirmation # XXXX | Date of Dispute : XX/XX/XXXX | Date of Completion : XX/XX/XXXX While on the phone with the Equifax Dispute Representative on XX/XX/XXXX filing the most recent dispute, the Representative said that if I were to include a Loan Verification Letter from XXXX XXXX in my dispute via mail, then the information could be updated and corrected. I followed her recommendation and mailed the official XXXX XXXX XXXX Verification Letter to the stated address. However, upon completion of the dispute, my information was not updated or corrected the credit report shows the same inaccuracies prior to the dispute. 

It is known that Equifax records all conversations with Customer Service Representatives for Quality Assurance Purposes. Thus, on XX/XX/XXXX, I called Equifax requesting the transcript of the conversation made on XX/XX/XXXX and was told that, despite being verified through their system, I could not make that request unless it was in writing and I provided a copy of my Social Security Card and Drivers License. I was told that the request must be made to the office in XXXX, GA the same location that I sent the loan verification letter. 

The amount of sheer negligence paid to my credit reporting is reprehensible. By refusing to correct this information despite my documented dispute attempts, I have been penalized financially due to Equifaxs inaction. As someone who has started anew and attempting to rebuild a financial future, Equifaxs negligence is creating an additional and unjust burden. If I want to buy a home, for example, this inaccurate reporting damages my chances of securing a mortgage. If I want to propose to my partner, a company from which I would purchase a ring would see this information and either charge me higher interest for the purchase or deny my application all together. I have been charged extraordinarily high interest rates in other financial endeavors thanks to, in large part, Equifaxs inaccurate reporting. Their behavior has real world implications. They must not be able to do this anymore to me or any other individual who is attempting to better his or her life.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2019 I logged into my Chase banking account to manage my finances. I noticed one of my two checking accounts balances seemed low so I double-checked the transactions. In doing so, I see 2 Quickpay with XXXX transactions on XX/XX/2019, one for {$1000.00} and the other for {$530.00}. I have never seen the names the money went to so I immediately called Chase customer service to report the fraud. They recommended me to visit a branch in-person to close the account. I immediately go to a branch to close my checking account that I had for 20 years and open a new one, to prevent any further fraudulent activity. Chase informed me that while they investigated they would temporarily reimburse the lost money. 

On XX/XX/2019 I received a letter dated XX/XX/2019 that Chase had completed their investigation and has found that the transactions were processed correctly or was authorized. Also that the funds that they had initially reimbursed me would be removed on XX/XX/2019. I immediately call the number listed on the letter in which the person I spoke with recommended I visit a branch instead. I return to the same branch near my house to dispute the letter. I go over the issue with the Assistant Branch Manager and she escalates the case with Chase Fraud Department. I asked Chase for the information that was used to determine my case and was told that they could not give that to me although in the letter, it specifically says that I could request it. Instead I was advised to take screenshots of my phone and laptop ip addresses and to email them to Chase Fraud Dept. The Asst. BM lets me know that it will take a few days for them to review the case but reassures me that she will keep me updated. 

On XX/XX/2019, Chase withdraws the funds as was indicated on the letter and I call the Asst. Branch manager to re-inquire about the status of my case. She lets me know that while they reopened the case, it was not possible to postpone the withdrawal and that currently the escalated case was still under investigation. She mentioned she would get back to me within another week to give me another update. 

As of today, XX/XX/2019, Chase has withdrawn funds from my account in the amount of {$1500.00} that was never authorized by me. Currently I am still waiting for an update and have reached out a few times by phone and email. I have not heard anything. 

I have been a loyal Chase customer for 20 years with 2 checking accounts and approximately 6 Chase credit cards. I requested them to review my usage habits as I believe it is quite evident in my behavior and reiterated that the 2 transactions were fraud. Absolutely incomprehensible that Chase would allow this kind of fraud to occur and then turn around and make me responsible for it. I will definitely rethink who I bank with if this is how Chase resolves their issues.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports

I first report on XX/XX/2019 XXXX # XXXX. I asked for a Master promissory Note Proving the Loans that they had under my name for there company. The CFPB dismissed my complaint because XXXX/Navient sent a Promissory Note that had nothing to do with the Loans they Claim they have on file for me. 

I have Attached to THIS complaint is the Promissory Note that XXXX/Navient attached with my first complaint ( # XXXX ). I have also attached what XXXX/Navient reporting to the creditors. 

Why are the Original Grantors not the same? Isnt the information suppose to match? 

I also asked my private loan carrier for A Master Promissory Note and I was shocked to find out that they have the same Promissory Note for my private loans that XXXX/Navient have for Federal loans for different schools. 

How is that possible? 

XXXX has told me on multiple occasions and by multiple employees when I have asked XXXX/Navient who my Original Grantor is ; there answer has changed atleast Twice, and now that I see that there reporting that XXXX is the Original Grantor. That's the third misinformation about this loan that they have given not just to me but multiple other companies. 

I have asked an employee and one of XXXX/Navient Managers for contact information to there legal Department. I was told that XXXX/Navient does not have a legal department. 

How do they handle lawsuits without a legal department? 

All conversations were recorded, I have had problems attaching them in the past, but if an email is provided I can submit those recordings Promptly.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX/XXXX/XXXX : Notified of unexpected dip in credit. Credit Karma listed " collection '' as reason. I had no idea I had been sent to collections before I checked my credit score! I called the agency listed as " Midwest Recovery Systems, LLC '' to question the collection. I was told that on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX I received medical care from " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, '' a company associated with a local hospital. I requested information and hinted that I wanted to dispute. 
XXXX/XXXX/XXXX : I called my local hospital and doctor, both of which had no record of me being ordered or receiving care on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, let alone XXXX XXXX. I called " Midwest Recovery Systems, LLC '' to tell them that I wanted to file a dispute. The representative verified that I received service from " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX '' on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX according to their records. I was told that the {$180.00} was what was left after insurance paid their part. He said that my only option to receive information, other than that from his business, would be to call " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX '' ... which just so happens to be bankrupt and without a valid phone number. I was told that I could file a dispute, and if my credit was still hurt, I could pay the {$180.00} during the process. After the dispute was settled, and if I was found correct, my {$180.00} would be returned to me. I was told the dispute process would take 60-90 days to be settled and that the process was started. 
XXXX/XXXX/XXXX : I called my insurance, who searched their archives for claims. They confirmed that they did not receive billing for any services in XXXX XXXX. I immediately called " Midwest Recovery Systems, LLC '' to see where we were in the dispute process. A week had passed since I thought the representative had filed the complaint. The rep 's boss answered my call. He stated that the dispute was never filed, since I was questioning receiving care 3 years ago. I told him that it was my impression ( as well as my mother and father who listened and recorded the phone call on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX ) that the dispute was filed. The manager said that the rep. never filed the dispute and left a note that we might pay. The manager then clarified that we could not file and pay in hopes of being reimbursed after the dispute, which was new knowledge since the representative told us we could. The manager then said that the " date of service '' ( XXXX/XXXX/XXXX ) may not truly be the actual " date I received care, '' which is another inconsistency from what I was told during both phone calls on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX & XXXX/XXXX/XXXX. I alerted the manager to inconsistencies between my communication with the manager and what I had been told previously. 
Summary : The company never alerted me to being sent to collections ; I found out after my credit score was affected. I established communication with them first by calling them after seeing my score. I was lied to about the dispute process : the rep. told me it started and to wait 60-90 days. I called a week later ( 7 days into the 30 I had to file the dispute ) to find out it was never filed! I was lied to about the date of service. I feel like I was being coerced into paying since the rep. said that I could pay the {$180.00} while in the dispute process and have the possibility of being reimbursed if I am found to not be responsible for the debt ( which I later found out was a lie ). Had I never called on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX & waited the 60-90 days as told, I would have unconsciously admitted guilt and been responsible to pay. Had I paid the {$180.00} to help my credit during the dispute process ( in hopes of reimbursement ) I would have forfeited all money, since unlike what I was told on XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, payment is admitting guilt. The inconsistencies among employers and communication with me, the client, is unfair business. Although the manager said the dispute process was officially started as of XXXX/XXXX/XXXX, I will mail a written notice to assure the process has started.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, I initiated an online money transfer of {$1.00} from my Bank of America checking account to a friends XXXX XXXX  account using XXXX and recipient using XXXX Quick pay. This transaction was as a refund of the money which the XXXX XXXX holder had loaned me for rent two weeks earlier ( also sent using the same online banking service ). The XXXX XXXX    holder had gone into a XXXX branch in late XX/XX/XXXX, where a bank official registered his email and phone number on the XXXX Quick Pay. 

After I made the payment, the XXXX XXXX  holder did not receive his money. I went into a XXXX XXXX to make a complaint and I was informed that it would take up to 5 days because it was my first time making a transfer to him. Five days passed, and the intended receiver went to make a complaint at his bank. There, he was informed that his phone number was unable to pair to his account because it was already in use by another XXXX XXXX account holder. Hence, the amount of {$1000.00} intended for him was deposited to a stranger who already has his current phone number registered. He was also informed that he could do nothing about it, and that only I, the sender could file a claim through my bank ( Bank of America ). I am a single mom, and soldier, who certainly can't enrich the life of a stranger who erroneously received money intended for someone else, or XXXX XXXX. We can only assume the stranger received it because neither of the banks disclosed the status of the funds. 

I initiated a claim through Bank of America ( Claim # XXXX ) on XXXX XXXX, XXXX. I have attached a copy of the result of the claim which states I should contact the other party directly for further assistance. I and the intended receiver have contacted XXXXXXXX XXXX and XXXX multiple times but they keep evading us with privacy laws. XXXX states that they can do nothing about it due to some fineprint which was never issued to either of us when we registered for the online banking service. 

XXXX is doing nothing to help the situation. In the first place, XXXX XXXX  was part of the problem cause they helped the customer register on the Quick pay, and did not inform him after his phone number was not paired to his account. Bank of America in turn has reached out to XXXX twice and got nothing. The money is in XXXX, if XXXX can not get it out, then they should be held liable. Bank of America asked me to file a police report, which I did and nothing came out of it. The police couldn't understand why they should get involved in this when the banks should get it resolved. Also, some bank officials were also surprised at the unresolved situation, while others told me it happens but it is uncommon. 

Bank officials encourage customers to use the XXXX online banking app, and do not educate customers of the risk. There is also no visible agreement or fine-print available at sign up. If the customer is liable for errors, won't we all walk into the bank for funds transfer or use the regular online banking the requires account number and routing numbers? 

I hope that this can be resolved as soon as possible through your office. Thanks for your time.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of XXXX, we began the process of refinancing our mortgage. We competitively compared our existing mortgage company, Bank of America, NA to alternative mortgage providers. Our existing mortgage company, BOA offered a significantly better refinancing opportunity. On XX/XX/XXXX, the closing company issued us a closing disclosure for us to review, specifically indicating the closing cost and the payoff of the existing mortgage. This was in preparation for our closing on XX/XX/XXXX. We reviewed the numbers and agreed with the statement. The date of closing, XX/XX/XXXX, the closing attorney showed up at our house, and we reviewed the closing documents together and they were the same as the XXXX. The payoff was specifically {$310000.00} payable to Bank of America, NA. ( BOA ). The numbers on the Universal Loan Application matched the disclosure ; in addition, on the Schedule of Real Estate Owned was the same as the above {$310000.00}. It is important to note, this schedule was produced prior to closing, so, at closing, we had further confirmation that the {$310000.00} was what was owed to BOA, NA. Towards the end of the stack of closing documents, there was the document entitled, Impound Account Payoff. I was requested to sign this without being given any information that the impound account was my escrow account. No where on any document, statement, or any legal document did it indicate how much, if any of my escrow money would be used to lower my loan amount. By not disclosing this to us, it made the alternative mortgage lender 's quote look considerably higher, because BOA was misleading us on what the loan value would be by lowering it with the use of our existing escrow dollars. We could never get an apples to apples comparison, which we are owed by the Truth in Lending Act. This also seems to be puzzling that BOA would use our escrow money, that was due to pay out property taxes in 2 months, to get us to refinance with them as opposed to another lender. Why would BOA, who did pay our property taxes in XX/XX/XXXX, with their own money, since they depleted out escrow account, if not to mislead us into using them over the alternative mortgage company? 
At the beginning of XX/XX/XXXX, one year after refinancing, we were sent a letter from BOA indicating a shortfall in our escrow account, and that we needed to pay them approximately {$5100.00} to correct the shortfall. I was completely taken by surprise because I have paid my full mortgage and escrow amount every month since owning this house. No where during the refinancing process did anyone from BOA ever mention that our escrow would be used to reduce the value of the loan, as opposed to paying off our property taxes and hazard insurance, as what it was prescribed for. Since being informed of the shortfall, I have spoken to numerous BOA employees who have agreed they can not find anywhere in the closing documents that escrow money and how much of them were being used to lower the cost of the loan. They have acknowledged and agreed with us on the actual numbers on our closing statement and there was no indication of transfer of escrow funds from the initial loan to lower the loan amount on the refinanced loan. I have since been contacted by an escalating agent who has flatly said I signed the Impound Account Payoff and owe the money. I find it puzzling that BOA would deplete the escrow money we are mandated to pay forward, thus making them responsible to pay our property taxes for the next year. That is illogical : the reason why escrow is set up is for the consumer to pay the taxes and insurance and not the bank. I believe the reason why we were not informed of BOA 's intentions was either a mistake on BOA 's part or outright fraud to secure our business for the refinance.

I requested they remove the credit check from my credit reports and they refused. I beleive this practice is FRAUDULENT.

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a personal loan from the XXXX XXXX, XXXX branch of XXXX XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, my wife and I filed Chapter XXXX Bankruptcy which included that loan. The bankruptcy was completed on XX/XX/XXXX, and the loan is being properly listed on my credit report as Chapter XXXX Bankruptcy. 

However there is another loan listed on my credit report under XXXX XXXX. It was also reportedly issued on XX/XX/XXXX, with a last payment made date of XX/XX/XXXX, the exact dates reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX. This loan is being reported as Unpaid Balance Charged Off. I have never applied for or received a loan from XXXX XXXX, and certainly did not apply for or receive two entirely different loans on XX/XX/XXXX, as is currently claimed on my credit report. 

In XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX merged with XXXX XXXX , XXXX and on XX/XX/XXXX, the company became known as XXXX XXXX. It appears that sometime between the merger and the final discharge of the debt, the account was transferred from XXXX XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX, resulting in a new account number. That doesn't make it a new loan or change the fact it was discharged, however. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I submitted an online dispute with TransUnion, identifying the duplication and noting this was likely the same loan reported twice. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a reply claiming the accounts were verified as accurate. I'm not sure how it was verified, but someone, somewhere, is mistaken. 

I contacted the main office of XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, to correct this error. I spoke with XXXX and explained the problem, and was transferred to XXXX at the XXXX XXXX, XXXX branch. After I explained again, XXXX told me that her manager, XXXX, was out of the office but would return my call the following day. On the XXXX, my wife spoke with XXXX, and explained the situation yet again. He stated repeatedly there was nothing he could do and claimed if TransUnion was saying it was verified, then it must be accurate. He suggested we contact an attorney if we had further questions. 

I am trying very hard to make sure my credit report is accurate and have hit a brick wall here. On XX/XX/XXXX, after my wife spoke with XXXX, I contacted TransUnion by phone to dispute their results and still have not received any indication that they are doing anything to correct this problem.

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer ; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. ( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft ; ( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed ; ( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section ; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block. ( c ) Authority to decline or rescind. ( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions. ( 2 ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title. ( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block. ( d ) Exception for resellers. ( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller ; ( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer ; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft. ( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information. ( 3 ) Notice. In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale. ( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negotiable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section 1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft. ( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify - through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract - any and all accounts you post on a credit report. Otherwise, anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. I demand to see Verifiable Proof ( an original Consumer Contract with my Signature on it ) you have on file of the accounts listed below. Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must remove the accounts listed below. I demand the following accounts be verified or removed immediately

Product: Mortgage
Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Our loan officer, XXXX XXXX, NMLS # XXXX, from Key Bank, had stated that the processing and closing can take a long time with the bank. We were ok with that and entered into a 75-day rate lock starting in early XXXX. We were attempting to refinance and do a second loan for cash out. 

We received an email from the processor in the first week of XXXX claiming the loan would be closed by XX/XX/XXXX. We sent every document requested immediately. 

After the email from the processor, we did not receive communication from anyone for weeks. We repeatedly called our loan officer and he never answered the phone or responded to our voicemails. We emailed the processor, loan officer and closer, all  copied on the email from XXXX, and nobody responded to our emails. 

XXXX comes, and we still have not heard anything back from the company about when the loan is going to close. Finally, the closer emails us and asks for more documentation that we provide immediately. 

The first loan appears as if it will close before the 75 day rate lock expired, but the second loan did not appear to be able to close in time.

We still have not heard back from our loan officer at this point and we decide we're going to go with a different bank and email everyone in the loop as such. Lo and behold, the loan officer calls and needs more documentation, which we provide without delay. 

Amazingly, Key Bank is able to close both loans on XXXX XXXX, meaning the funds and payoff should be delivered by XX/XX/XXXX. There was money due from us at closing which was something that our loan officer, processor or closer had not communicated to us. 

We close on the XXXX, but the bank did not pay off our mortgage servicer or pay us until the XX/XX/XXXX. When we were concerned about where the money was and why Key Bank did not pay off the holder of our mortgage, we called the loan officer again. He did not answer and did not return our calls until after the loan had funded on the XXXX. The processor, loan officer and closer also did not respond to emails and questions about the payoff being late. 

We contacted our previous mortgage holder, the title company and eventually the customer service line at Key Bank, and no one could provide any explanation as to why the money was not sent on the day it was supposed to be sent. We still do not know why Key Bank took extra days to fund our loan. 

We are extremely upset about the absolute lack of communication throughout the process and are filing a complaint so others know not to trust Key Bank when it comes to mortgages. We also had to pay {$500.00} up front for an application fee.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
I set up an account with Coinbase out of XXXX XXXX, CA on XX/XX/XXXX. They required typical account opening information along with photo i.d . that I sent by using my phone to take a photo of the front and back. They also needed payment information for when I decided to do any transactions ( buying bitcoin or other such crypto currency ). I provided my banks routing number and account number. As of XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from Coinbase saying I was ready to buy. I was able to log in to the pc with my username and password. Please take note that I was never asked to submit a selfie when opening up my acount ... just the drivers license ( this is not a critical issue, but makes a point later ). I then began to make purchases of bitcoin on various days until I achieved how much I wanted. I then took a short break. While I was on vacation XX/XX/XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX I downloaded the Coinbase app on my XXXX phone. When I went to login it then asked me for an authenticator code. I did not have this on my phone set up so I just decided to do what I wanted from my pc when I got back. The next time I tried to log in and see my account was the morning of XX/XX/XXXX ( Tuesday ).  All of the sudden the website was now asking me for an authenticator code. I tried to set this up from my phone, but realized that coinbase did not provide me a key to open it. Ok I thought, they have a customer service number so I can have someone just verify who I am and get me back accessing my account. I called at XXXX in the morning ( pacific ) and held until I talked to someone. The rep tried to talk to me about the authenicator, but realized we would have to go a different route. He said after I login I must click below the box on " unable to submit a one time code ''. Then he said I must follow directions to reset my account. He then said it will go in for review and TAKE 48-72 HOURS to review. WOW! I am now locked away from my funds for 3 days minimum! Unable to sell if I need to? Never heard of such a thing. I asked to be escalated to a supervisor, was put on hold ... and then disconnected. I started looking up more about Coinbase and discovered many other instances of this. Decided the best thing to do was try and reset the account by going through the directions to reset my account ... ..even if it was 3 days, I need to do something. I logged back in and went through what the site asked for. I submitted a photo of my drivers license ( front and back ) and then it wanted a selfie from my webcam. After I submitted these it loaded and took some time, only to come back saying it failed validation because a photo was too big a file. It did not say which one. I could only assume the webcam one because I submitted the photos of my drivers license the same way setting up the account. I tried 2 more times to submit the photos while trying to shrink the file of my selfie. Each successive try failed for the same reason. I called the customer support again at XXXX ( pacific ) and spoke with a woman who said I should try using my phone with the XXXX browser. She talked me through the process. She said to use the camera on the phone from the site to take the photos. I tried holding up my drivers license in the photo box ( she said it will not use the rear camera ) and taking the photos of the license that way. I submitted and I was denied again! This time because the photo of my drivers license was not clear enough. I tried again 2 more times with her on the phone. Each time being denied for the same reason. She then said she will have to put me in contact with " direct support ''. She said that they will email me and have me send in the stuff direct. I questioned her on whether I would get a call from " direct support '' or I could call them. She said that they do not call direct for security reasons. That seems odd and terrible! I said ok, and waited for an email from this " direct support ''. I did not receive anything but an email telling me what to do to upload photos. Decided to try and resubmit the drivers license and selfie on the website. This time after taking them it denied me saying I tried too many attempts and could not again for 24 hours. WOW! I then decided to call back at XXXX XXXX  ( pacific ). I talked to a man who told me he did see that I was to be contacted by direct support. He said I should receive an email validating that. I said ok, but frustrated with all the run-around so far. I did get an email from coinbase saying that the support would email me and the reviews typically take from 4-5 business days, but sometimes longer ( I attached a screenshot of that email ). I decided there was nothing more I could do but research more on who could help me. This is where I found CFPB. Decided to sleep on it and take it up today ( XX/XX/XXXX ). Decided the first thing I would do is try again after the 24hours to resubmit the drivers license and selfie. This time I succeeded in getting the site to accept it. I now am waiting for the review and received an email saying it typically takes up to 72 hours ( 3 days ). 

Here are my concerns. They should addressed by coinbase : 1 ) Why was it so easy to set up my account without the selfie provided, but once coinbase received deposits from me and I got locked out, suddenly I have to go through many more challenging hoops.

2 ) It is unacceptable when a trading company such as coinbase has nothing better than a 3 day turnaround for clients who got locked out of their account. Ive worked for investment firms dealing with such matters, I have investments elsewhere, and NOWHERE is it like this. They always have someone available who can gain me access almost immediately. I am now waiting 3 days with money tied up in a speculative investment and if I get uneasy about owning I have nothing I can do. This is wrong! Also ... I still am not assured I will get my account verified. I will only get an answer in a minimum 3 days.

3 ) The tools to upload requested documents when someone gets locked out are awful. have directions on what the maximum file size can be. If someone is unsuccessful then there needs to be direct support who can call or be transferred to.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Sued you without properly notifying you of lawsuit
Consumer complaint narrative: I was sued by a collection agency named Markoff Law for an installment loan I took out with another company named XXXX XXXX XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX we reached a settlement agreement. The agreement stated I would make 3 payments of {$740.00} dollars beginning on XX/XX/XXXX in exchange no judgement would be filled and nothing would be put on my credit report and the debt would be paid in full. On XX/XX/XXXX I made the payment and faxed the signed agreement to Markoff Law and was told I did not have to go to court because they would have the judge sign the order and send me a copy. Instead Markoff Law took my payment and the signed agreement and still went to court on XX/XX/XXXX and filled a judgement for a higher amount and sent a garnishment on to my place of employment. I contacted Markoff Law and was told that a motion to dismiss would be filled. 3 weeks went by and they still did not fill a motion. So I filled a motion with the court to vacate the judgement. Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Problem with paying off the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: My wife had a lease thru ALLY Financial. On XX/XX/2018 a driver struck my wife 's XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX creating a total loss. The lease was still midway thru a 3 year lease. After the other driver was cited and contacting our insurance company they directed us to contact ALLY to get a payoff amount so we could search for another vehicle promptly. On XX/XX/XXXX I contacted ALLY financial informing them of the accident and requested the amount owed to ALLY for the vehicle so we could tell the insurance company. They provided us an amount of {$26000.00} was owed on the vehicle. XXXX XXXX valued the vehicle at {$30000.00} which would pay {$29000.00} after deductible. This made somewhat sense considering i put over {$3000.00} down on the vehicle on top of taxes and fees and we receive employee pricing with XXXX. We in turn had to immediately purchase another vehicle as once the vehicle is deemed a total loss the rental car is no longer covered. We took the amount ALLY provided us and used the {$3500.00} difference between that and what we would recieve from the insurance company towards another car. This is where myself and the insurance company are dumbfounded as ALLY would not give the insurance company a payoff amount. They said the insurance company must provide them with there payout evaluation so ALLY could provide a payoff amount. XXXX sent them the payoff amount of {$29000.00} and in turn ALLY sent them a letter of guarantee to release the title for the car for {$29000.00}. ALLY very conspicuously said there accounting department valued the car to the penny the same as XXXX 's payoff amount. We contacted ALLY notifying them of the error and this is where the predatory practices get really bad. ALLY transferred us to there total loss department. That department confirmed the payoff amount was {$26000.00} but once the vehicle is deemed a total loss it is there policy to collect the full amount the insurance company is willing to pay. I point blank asked them if the amount i owed them at the time was {$1000.00} would they be requesting the {$29000.00} from the insurance company and to my chagrin the female employee stated yes that is our policy. To be clear while leasing a {$35000.00} car whether you put XXXX dollars down or {$30000.00} down ALLY 's standard practice is not to accept what is owed to them it is to financially XXXX victims of accidents of the entire settlement amount to replace there vehicle. We have contacted ALLY with the insurance company many times and the adjuster is mindblown that ALLY wont give them a payoff amount and will only state they will accept the entire check for the vehicle to provide a letter of guarantee. I believe ALLY FINANCIAL is financially bankrupting, assaulting and taking advantage of consumers in there toughest times thinking these consumers will just take give in. I am more then happy to pay them what is owed which they confirmed on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX to be {$26000.00} so all parties can move on from this but ALLY now will not discuss the matter with myself, XXXX XXXX or anyone else besides to say we sent a payoff letter and you can pay that. I have instructed my insurance company to put the claim on hold until this matter can be amicably resolved. But these predatory practices needed to be brought to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's attention so that the thousands if not millions of ALLY costumers aren't at risk of this fraudulent activity. I dont know how to pay ALLY and move on from this situation and either does XXXX XXXX. Hopefully this process will alleviate this issue.

Issue: Applying for a mortgage or refinancing an existing mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Before I get started there was a case already opened, concerning this issue back in XXXX Id XXXX. At that time our investor WMC Mortgage Corporation, through the servicers XXXX   XXXX  held the second mortgage loan, on our home located here in California XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Ca, XXXX. Their excuse back the was that we failed to provide, information requested by XXXX. This process went back and forth over the course of several years. They XXXX XXXX always claiming they never received requested documentation, which I sent on several occasions. 
During the course of our last communication in XXXX of XXXX, with XXXX  during the height of our once again attempting to negotiate, a modification, our second mortgage was then sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. 
Now lets step back, in XXXX, I lost my working as a XXXX XXXX, for XXXX XXXX XXXX My salary at the time was {$81000.00} per year. I was gainfully unemployed for, a period of 5 years. During that time period I was able to acquire part time and temporary employment. I did not return to full time employment until XX/XX/XXXX. 
During this time frame is when we fell behind on the second mortgage, from XX/XX/XXXX thru XX/XX/XXXX we were able to maintain our second mortgage payment. During this same period of time, the value of our home fell, to the point where we ended up being over {$200000.00} upside down with our mortgage. All along from XXXX thru the present day XXXX, we continued to maintain the payment on our first mortgage. 
In late XXXX we contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, requesting their assistance. The main goal in contacting XXXX was to obtain a Principal Reduction in our property value, to bring our property back to the actual market value. This was accomplished on XX/XX/XXXX. 
This brought our home from the original amount we paid for this residence {$430000.00} to the actual market value at the time which was in the {$200000.00} range. 
At the time we had no available equity in our home. 
After the Principal Reduction was place through XXXX, in XXXX the equity on this property began to climb. 
Now once the loan was transferred from XXXX XXXX To XXXX XXXX in XXXX of XXXX, XXXX XXXX immediately began the foreclosure process, since by this time period the property had acquired over {$100000.00} of equity. 
Mind you we had no idea that the loan had been transferred, as we were in the process of working out a modification with XXXX. 
Since acquiring the second mortgage we have been the victims of the predatory lending practices of our investor WMC Mortgage Corporation. 
Who have never attempted in good faith to try and offer a modification on this second mortgage. 
We have been forced to file chapter XXXX bankruptcy, in order to maintain residency here at our home located @ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Ca, XXXX. The only recourse XXXX has offered is 1. ) pay the rearrange of {$59000.00} or pay the entire secure amount of {$130000.00} Which include the original loan amount of {$82000.00} plus the rearrange. 
Now XXXX is charging a late fee for every months mortgage, not paid plus interest on the late charge, along with interest on the unpaid balance of the entire balance due on the second mortgage. 
As I stated these are unlawful predatory lending practices, in which WMC Mortgage Corporation should not be allowed to continue to get away with. 
Mind you WMC Mortgage Corporation themselves filed For bankruptcy protection in XXXX. 
We have been residing in our home now for 13 years and are taking all steps in order to continue to maintain residency in our home. We are represented by XXXX XXXX XXXX, who are working with XXXX  on behalf of WMC Mortgage Corp to obtain a reasonable modification. So far WMC has not budged on its demand to foreclose on our home. We are reaching out to you for your assistance in this matter

Consumer complaint narrative: Since XX/XX/XXXX ; I have been proactively trying to get inaccurate, non-compliant accounts to be updated correctly on my credit report by submitting the appropriate requests and supporting documentation from the creditors/collectors showing the account status is to be updated to paid and the comments showing either paid in full or paid and settled for less than full amount. The bureaus and creditors/collections agencies just point blame and constantly send me back and forth for resolution. The creditors and collections agencies did supply me with supporting documentation since XX/XX/XXXX showing the accounts were to be updated to accurately reflect the correct status yet the bureaus continue to fail and report inaccurately and non-compliantly. I have been trying to amicably resolve this and have since been denied a mortgage due to the negligence of both parties. XXXX XXXX, XXXX & Equifax continue to be negligent and I am seeking the accurate updates per the supporting documentation to be completed immediately. Thank you,

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
We are filing this complaint against our servicer, RoundPoint Mortgage. We requested assistance with our mortgage payments due to unemployment, and was informed by RoundPoint Mortgage that we filled out a Uniform Borrower Assistance Form. We complied and returned the form on XX/XX/XXXX. We kept in touch with RoundPoint Mortgage throughout the process. Later on, on XX/XX/XXXX, additional documents were requested by RoundPoint Mortgage by XXXX XXXX, and they were faxed to her on XX/XX/XXXX. We received an " Evaluation Summary '' dated XX/XX/XXXX, stating that we had been approved for FHA 's Making Home Affordable Modification program. In addition, RoundPoint Mortgage included paperwork with these forms dated XX/XX/XXXX, for a letter of agreement for a trial period of 4 payments in the amount of {$1500.00}, due on the XXXX of each month starting XX/XX/XXXX, and ending with the 4th and final payment of the trial period on XX/XX/XXXX. The letter requested that we sign if we agreed to the terms sign and return the forms by XX/XX/XXXX, and we did sign them on XX/XX/XXXX, and returned the forms the same day. The payments were made according to the terms for the entire trial period. We called to speak with our " point of contact '' ( XXXX XXXX ) until we couldn't reach her any longer and had to settle for " the next available agent '' on a regular basis to get an update to the finalization of the modified loan agreement. We continued to receive billing statements that we were behind on our mortgage, but when we would call in about the statements, many times we would reach XXXX  and he would tell us not to worry about the statements, and that they would be corrected when RoundPoint Mortgage finished " updating our account '' with the information from the documents they had received from us, and that we were to continue to make the modified payments of {$1500.00}.

On XX/XX/XXXX, we received a XXXX  envelope from RoundPoint Mortgage with the " Loan Modification Agreement '' for us to sign and have notarized. We signed the forms, had them notarized and returned them via XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. We kept in touch with RoundPoint Mortgage for updates to the finalization of the " Loan Modification Agreement. '' We received forms dated XX/XX/XXXX, about a week or so later, stating that we would find " a fully executed copy of the Loan Modification Agreement dated XX/XX/XXXX. '' We continued to contact RoundPoint Mortgage about our account not being updated, and when would the account reflect the new terms. When we reached the next agent available, again it would be XXXX  sometimes, and he stated like others before and after him, that we should ignore the billing statements and that he sent an " escalation request '' to his manager, supervisor or someone in that capacity. This continued through XXXX, XXXX and then in XXXX we received a letter stating that we were behind two months in our mrotgage payments. I called, XX/XX/XXXX, and was connected to XXXX. I believe it was at this time that XXXX  told me that there was a new modified payment and that there was a shortage in payments for the XXXX and XXXX   mortgage payments. Since I was still paying {$1500.00} instead of {$1500.00} according to him, there was a difference of {$26.00} for each of the two months in question. We paid the difference of {$52.00} to bring the account back up to date. I also asked XXXX   why was it taking so long to correct the statements. I stated that I felt that someone dropped the ball, but he said instead that no one dropped the ball on either end, but that there were a few things that needed to be updated. It was wasn't until about a two weeks later that XXXX told me that it had been a mistake ( s ) made on their end, ( RoundPoint Mortgage ), that was the cause of the stall with the updating of our account. In addition, XXXX  stated that we need to keep making the modified loan agreement payments of {$1500.00} and he was noting the account.

Then around the second week of XX/XX/XXXX, we receive a phone call from RoundPoint Mortgage about a lien being on the home and this is what was an issue, and that we needed to fill out a " Non-Identity Affidavit. '' We did on XX/XX/XXXX and mailed and/or emailed it back with the requested proof from court to verify that there was a mistaken identity issue, and sent both documents back to RoundPoint Mortgage the same day. We continued to stay in contact with RoundPoint Mortgage on a bi-monthly basis and it was almost a month after they asked us to give them two weeks to get everything in order, that they tell us when we call in XX/XX/XXXX, that they sent in another " escalation request. '' The representative stated that they were making a note on the account, and to continue to make the modified loan payments of {$1500.00}.

Recently, we received a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, on XX/XX/XXXX from RoundPoint Mortgage that we have been granted a " Loan Forbearance Plan '' and that we are behind {$9900.00}. It included a request for us to sign the Forbearance forms and return by XX/XX/XXXX. We signed and returned the forms on XX/XX/XXXX. I called on XX/XX/XXXX, and spoke to a representative that told me we had to pay the late payments and the new mortgage amount of {$2000.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, even though we were offered and accepted a Modified Loan Agreement in XX/XX/XXXX, and it was recorded with the county in XX/XX/XXXX.

We were given the excuses of an " early payment during the modified payment schedule '' and that " the debt wasn't reaffirmed before the debt was discharged '' as to why the modified loan agreement was, with no prior explanation prior to RoundPoint Mortgage finalizing the Modified Loan Agreement back in XXXX of XX/XX/XXXXwith the county.

Consumer complaint narrative:
ATTENTION : HUD-OIG AND CFPB AMENDED XX/XX/2019 VA HOME LOAN OVER PRICE {$300000.00}. BUILTXXXX. 

XX/XX/2019 COMPLAINT AGAINST ( UWM ) UNITED WHOLESALE MORTGAGE. 

PRICE PLACED UPON THIS HOUSE WE BOUGHT IN XX/XX/2019, ISN'T EVEN WORTH. {$300000.00}. I DISCLOSED HERE BELOW THE CONDITION FINDING HUMONGOUSLY BAD. 

THANK YOU FOR THE INFORMATION : I CERTAINLY ASKING FOR HELP WITH OUR ( VA HOME LOAN ) THROUGH ; " UNITED WHOLESALE MORTGAGE '' HERE IN XXXX, ARIZONA. WE FELT LIKE WE BEING OVERLY CHARGED. AS FAR AS PRICE WISE FOR THIS OLD HOME WE BOUGHT FROM THEM ... IN THE AMOUNT OF : {$300000.00}. AND ISN'T WORTH THE PRICE. 

AFTER A MONTH WE MOVED IN..WE DISCOVERED SEVERAL DISCREPANCIES INSIDE THE HOUSE. IT DEEMED LIKE NO INSPECTION WAS EVER MADE TO THIS HOUSE BEFORE PUT IT ON THE MARKET. ACCORDING TO ITS CONDITIION. " DIRTY FLOOR, CEILLING LIGHTS & FANS AREN'T WORKING PROPERLY, REMOTE-CONTROL TYPE FANS & LIGHTS FIXTURED. SOME CEILLING BRACKET LEFT WITH WIRES HANGING WITHOUT A LIGHT BRACKET. 

SLIDING DOOR IN THE BACK TO THE SWIMMING POOL. AND PATIO CAN'T EVEN OPEN, WAS FULL OF MUD, AND DIRTS. WE HAVE TO SCRAPED THEM OFF CLEAN, IN ORDER TO FREE THE GLASS DOOR, AND SCREEN DOOR TO MOVE FREELY. 

THE SWIMMING POOL WAS ABSOLUTELY DIRTY FILTHY, CAN'T EVEN SEE " TILES DESIGNS '' DUE TO SCUMS COVERED IT. WE HIRED POOL PEOPLE TO DRAINED AND CLEAN-UP INSIDE, AND REFILLED COST US HUGE AMOUNT OF MONEY. SPRINKLERS WAS NOT WORKING AT ALL, EXCEPT ; WASTING LOTS OF WATER FLOWING EVERY WHICH-WAY ; AND NOT SPRINKLING UP AS IT SUPPOSE TO : COST {$700.00} DOLLARS. TOILETS, KITCHEN, GROVES ALONG THE WALLS INSIDE THE WHOLE HOUSE ITSELF ARE EXTREMELY DIRTY. 

WE DID SIGNED THE CONTRACT, and it falls under : " FALSE STATEMENTS STATUTE '' SECTION ( 2 ) Especially, the general federal Statute, 18 U.S.C. 1001, which makes it a crime in dealings with the federal government to ( 1 ) falsify or conceal a material fact, ( 2 ) make a materially false statement, or ( 3 ) make or use a document known to contain a materially false statement or entry. Wilful Concealment. 

To which ; Compensatory Damages, and Punitive Damages can be consider from the defendant 's conduct is deemed especially egregious. Discourage repetition of such conduct, and set an example for others who might be tempted to engage in similar conduct. 

We are asking for a Rectification price ; placed upon this house. Its NOT Worth {$300000.00} dollars. According to its condition ; NOT reasonable, logically justifiable or justified, conforming to or in accordance with established rules, standards, principles of LAWS AND CONSTITUTIONS. Also ; my Tax-Exemption and my VA home loan benefit, entitlement has not been considering, nor acknowledge at all. Still shown on ESCROW payment  legitimately. 

Respectfully : XXXX & XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX VETERAN XXXX   XXXX XXXX C/O XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Arizona XXXX

There is a class action lawsuit ( so I am not the only one who sees that this is being handled poorly ) but I would prefer to get an answer ( and now an apology ) to my simple question. Why do big companies behave so badly??

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/, 2019 I received the first phone call from National Credit Systems Inc. XXXX XXXX was the employee who spoke to me. He used aggressive and loud language and while attempting to understand if the debt was added XXXX my credit report, he hung up on me. 

I called back and reached him where he told me if I didnt listen to what he had to say he would hang up on me again. I asked to speak to the manager, and he hung up on me. 

On XX/XX/XXXX he called me back and I told him I would make a complaint if he spoke aggressively toward me one more time. I was able to tell him that I am not disputing all of the charges owed, but my previous lease did not require me to pay for some of it. He stated that he filed the dispute. 

On XX/XX/, 2019 XXXX XXXX called me back and stated that the lease he had did not contain literature about pet damage. Once I realized the apartment complex provided the wrong lease, I provided the updated lease that included the pet addendum. I told her what paragraph to find the literature and we disconnected neutrally. 

On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX called me and spoke to me. He explained that the apartment complex would not remove the disputed amount of money. He told me that he never asked me for an updated lease and that he did not know what I was talking about. I reminded him that I in fact sent the email to his XXXX, XXXX XXXX with he email he provided me. 

XXXX asked me why it was a big deal to dispute the small amount that was owed instead of paying it. I told him my lease stated I was only responsible for a replacement and not a repair, as the literature stated. XXXX XXXX interrupted me and disconnected the phone call. 

National Credit Systems is refusing to mediate the amount owed and refusing to understand the literature of the lease in question. National Credit Systems is using harassing tactics to prevent me from paying only the money I owe. I have stated many times I am not disputing the majority of the debt and I am willing to make payments. I am unwilling to pay for what I am not responsible. National Credit Systems is attempting to stall on the issue to allow for enough time for the debt to go into  collections for purposes of profiting. I attempted to speak to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX but was only allowed to leave a voice mail and was told he would not accept my call.

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative: Checked Equifax credit report via XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, which contained inaccurate personal address information. I used the Equifax online dispute function, which strangely did not allow completion of the dispute online, but rather insisted that I provide multiple ( 3 ) documents to prove my identity, by FAXING or MAILING, within 24 hours ... just to remove an erroneous address from my credit file. I collected the required documentation and attempted to fax the dispute form and identifying documents to Equifax on XX/XX/XXXX ( same day, well within 24 hours ). The fax number provided by Equifax ( XXXX ) reported on 2 different fax systems as " not in service. '' Yes, I can send the multiple documents Equifax insists I provide by postal mail. However, Equifax has made this process too ridiculous and ineffectual. If Equifax requires me to fax 3 different documents to prove my identity then Equifax should certainly should make sure the fax number listed on their dispute form is IN SERVICE. Instead, Equifax appears to be levying too many requirements on the dispute submission process, and then failing to provide a workable online or fax mode for submitting a dispute, all in an attempt to discourage consumers from legitimate efforts to correct their credit file.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Indicated you were committing crime by not paying debt
Consumer complaint narrative: I called into Franklin Collection Services in XXXX Mississippi on XX/XX/XXXX. I called because I saw on my credit report that they reported the same delinquent account 6 separate times to my credit report. The dates areXX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX. The amount of the debt reported is {$430.00} and the original creditor is XXXX XXXX XXXX. The address that was on file with them was an old address so I gave them all of my updated information. I explained the reason for me not knowing that the debt was owed and that I was calling to get it resolved. I asked for a verification of debt letter, and I that I would gladly pay the debt in full and wanted to know if they could delete all the reports to the credit bureaus considering the situation. I also asked why the same debt was continually being reported just days apart, and I was told XXXX XXXX XXXX lets them re-report the debt every 3 days. These continuous report dropped my credit score dramatically, over 100 points. All the while, I didnt know about the debt because they didnt have my correct info. XXXX XXXX was the representative I was speaking with that night, XX/XX/XXXX. She told me she would call me back the next night to confirm with me that the letter was sent out to the correct address. The next night I received a call and missed it but called right back at XXXX pm, and the date was XX/XX/XXXX. I dont recall if if XXXX said the letter went out or not because the conversation escalated rather quickly. She told me her supervisor said that if I paid the balance in full they would remove it from my credit. I asked if I could get a letter mailed stating that they would follow through on that agreement, and at that point they become very ugly. From this point forward the rest of the call was very combative. They refused to send me anything about the agreement in writing which was a big red flag for me. I told them that I have learned that if its not in black and white it didnt happen. XXXX started telling me that I was going back on our deal, but still to this day, we have not come to any agreement. She was saying that I had wasted her time because I wouldnt pay them right then ( I had not received the verification of debt letter, so at this point I didnt know if this was a legitimate debt or not ). The rest of the conversation is kind of a blur as to who I was speaking with because it was a loud aggressive tone from their end, but I was transferred to two other people, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX. Between XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX, I was told that had to pay them right then or they wouldnt deal with me at all. They were demanding I give them a check over the phone or card information right then. I kept trying to tell them that I had not received the verification of debt letter yet, but they would not acknowledge that or even give me enough time to get it out of my mouth. They just kept telling me that they dont send the terms of an agreement before before they get paid ( big red flag for me ) and that I just dont want to pay they because Im not getting my way. At one point I was told that they used to mail the agreements out to consumers but dont any more because consumers wouldnt pay them after getting the agreement. Then I was told that it had alway been their company policy to never give consumers a written agreement. Now for the lie, The last person I spoke with, XXXX I believe, said that it was illegal for them to send a written agreement before being paid in full. They kept saying they can send the agreement after I paid them. I asked if it was company policy or illegal because the last person said it was company policy. I was then told it was illegal because the fair credit reporting act said that it was illegal. He kept saying that it was illegal and they wouldnt send me an agreement because it was illegal, and they dont do anything illegal. The person I believe to be XXXX not only was lying to try to get me to pay them right then, but talked to be like a complete dog, belittling me, and would not let me say hardly anything at all. I attempted to tell him several time the situation and that there was no agreement yet, and that I had not received verification of the debt, it was all him practically yelling through the phone. I finally got to the point that I was done speaking with them and said thank you for your text me and hung up the phone. XXXX called me again the next day and asked if I had tried to call her that morning, and I said no and we got off the phone. I received another call from them today, XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX  and missed the call but called back at XXXX. On this call they told me that if I pay half then they would send me the agreement but wouldnt delete it from my credit until the other half was paid. I am not sure of this persons name. When I asked about the last call me being told that because of the fair credit reporting act it was illegal to send a written agreement, the question was side stepped and I was to that they dont delete anything, that they were doing me a favor. Once again there was not an agreement reached because I couldnt get a written agreement before making payment and at this time I still have not received the verification of debt letter. I told them that I had not gotten the verification of debt letter yet, so wasnt willing to make any payment until I received that and the written agreement. I also told them that since they were unwilling to send the agreement, I had to go with my safest option, calling the original creditor and trying to arrange payment with them so that the collection agency would have to delete the because because they had not rights to the debts. They didnt seem happy about this and told me that I couldnt do that because the creditor wouldnt pull the debt back. They then terminated the call. During the calls, I told them that I needed a written agreement so that I could hold them accountable for their end and they said they would have to hold up their end because the calls were recorded. I told them that I didnt have the ability to record the calls, so that didnt really do me any good. The reason I asked for the agreement in writing is because I dont actually trust that they will follow with the deletion once being paid. Being told that I can get the written agreement after I pay them sounds like a complete scam to me. The last time I was told I get the agreement only after paying was from an extended car warranty scam. Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX In XXXX my family and I moved back to XXXX from XXXX I had been hurt while performing duties as a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and moved back to my home state. The injuries generated, and were further aggravated, from initial military injuries that I received while deployed to XXXX in XXXX. 
My family and I lived in two different homes after our move to XXXX. Both of those homes where serviced by XXXX XXXX using their budget billing process. During the service years from XXXX through XXXX I had no problems with XXXX XXXX and all bills where paid on time. 
In XXXX my family moved to XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX. We transferred our XXXX XXXX   policy to this address. XXXX XXXX services this home through XXXX XXXX. In the winter of XXXX we had a house fire and suspended our account until approximately XX/XX/XXXX for this address as the home was being rebuilt. When we moved back into the home in XXXX we again started the budget billing process for our propane usage. 
When we restarted our account with XXXX XXXX  in the fall of XXXX fuel prices where very volatile. Prices were going up, so my wife and I were concerned that we would not be able to have an escalating propane bill because of my injury status and being on a fixed income. My wife and I went to the manager at XXXX, in the XXXX office, propane and asked them if they could fix our price so that we would have the same bill every month. We told the lady that if we could not come to some type of agreement we would be forced to consider other options for a carrier as the price of propane may become too expensive for us. 
After having this conversation with the manager at XXXX XXXX in XXXX she said that she would consider options for us. Approximately a week later she contacted me and told me that management had looked at my account and said that they would deliver propane to my address for a flat fee of {$2.00} a gallon due to my use and account history. My family agreed to this fee and remained with XXXX XXXX 
In the spring of XXXX I woke up one morning to a very cold house. I built up the wood stove to get things warmed up for my family and then started to research why everything was so cold. I found that the propane tank was completely empty providing no heat. 
I called XXXX XXXX to inquire why my tank was empty because I was on budget billing and the tank should have been monitored monthly and kept full. They sent XXXX XXXX out to look at the tank and fill it for us. When XXXX arrived, he was very apologetic. He stated that he had not been tracking our tank for several months as we had not used propane very much for years. My primary source of heat was wood so the only thing the propane was used for was the cook stove. XXXX XXXX stated that he stopped monitoring our tank months earlier because we were never showing any use. 
I informed him that over the winter I had my XXXX mother staying with us and I needed to keep the house at a move even temperature and was using the propane as a secondary source to do so. XXXX had his safety people come and do a safety check on the line and then he filled up the tank. 
The supervisor at XXXX XXXX  called us to apologize for the lack in service and offered to give us a cut rate on the propane in the tank. So, she computed the usage for the amount filled, subtracted what I had paid, and then gave me a further deduction for them not servicing the tank on a regular basis. My mother paid the account in full through her checking account because the propane was being used primarily for her. 
Approximately two weeks later I was contacted by XXXX XXXX. The man stated that we did owe a further bill on our account. I was mystified. How could I owe you if we paid our budget billing and then satisfied the account once they had refilled our tank due to there lack of service. He stated that the lady that managed the accounts was billing us at the 2.10 rate and then was keeping a side ledger, off the books, of overages. I told the individual that I could not make any sense out of what he was talking about. We had always paid our bill on time. Our tank ran empty and then we paid that bill in full when the tank was made full again. 
He stated that the other manager did not have the authority to give us a contract for the 2:10 rate and because she had done so, to keep our services, she maintained a side account that showed an overage. My wife and I told him that we would come down to look at what he had. When we arrived at XXXX the gentleman told us we owed his company funds. At that time, we asked to speak with the lady that gave us the contract. He informed us that she had been fired. We asked to see our contract with our signature. He informed us that they could not find a contract with our signature giving us the rate of XXXX. We then asked to look at the side ledger that was being kept and he refused to let us see the document. 
I informed him at that time that I would not pay any further on the account until he could show me proof that the money was owed. I wanted the contract, to speak with the lady who gave us the contract, and I wanted documented proof of the side ledger. He refused. My wife and I left the building. 
We contacted XXXX XXXX and hired them for our propane services. We contacted XXXX XXXX  to have their tank removed from our property, they complied. XXXX XXXX XXXX the property until it was sold in XXXX. 
Over the following two months after the removal of the XXXX XXXX tank XXXX sent us a bill for the overage on the account. Each time my wife and I went to the XXXX building in XXXX and asked to see our contract, speak to the lady that gave us the contract, and see the side ledger for the overage. Each time the contract could not be found, and we were denied our other two requests. We informed XXXX at that time that we would no longer be dealing with them and that all accounts were satisfied and paid in full according to us. XXXX no longer sent us a ledger. 
We moved from the residence on XXXX XXXX to XXXX, Idaho in XXXX and sold the home on XXXX XXXX in XXXX. During that time XXXX XXXX had no further contact with us about the issue. We figured that matter was closed. 
In the fall of XXXX as we were contracting to move back into a home in XXXX  we were contacted by a collections company about a bill for XXXX XXXX from XXXX. We had no accounts with XXXX XXXX in XXXX. I contacted XXXX XXXX in XXXX and asked them why I was receiving a bill from a collections company. The lady stated that the company had been reviewing old accounts and ours came up as past due so the bill was sent to collections. After speaking to her about the history of the account I again asked for the missing contract, the ladies name and contact information that gave authorized the contract, and proof of the side ledger. She could not provide those documents. I Informed her that we would not be making any payments on an account that had been satisfied in full on the day XXXX came up to fill the tank after letting it run dry. I asked that the company foreclose on the account and take me to court to speak to a judge about the account. 
I contacted the collections company and informed them that I was disputing the account. I had no account from XXXX in XXXX. I contacted the credit monitoring companies and disputed the account. I asked The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX Spruce XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to verify this account and send me the contract and all information to prove this debt within the thirty day window to dispute the account. Nothing was ever sent or received by me. 
At this time the XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, account is being shown on my three credit report files as late past due since XXXX. Several companies have denied me credit for purchases and I have received higher credit amounts for accounts that I have opened due to XXXX showing a false account on my credit reports. XXXX refused to foreclose or provide documentation as requested for this matter. 
I have contacted both XXXX XXXX and the XXXX XXXX several times about this matter. Each time I have asked for proof of this debt but have been denied. The account is showing it is from XXXX instead of XXXX. No contract, side ledger, or information from the manager that issued the contract has been sent to me. The new manager at XXXX stated that the old, fired manager, did not have the authority to enter into the contract that she made. She was their agent and I entered that contract in good faith and was never late on a payment to XXXX for my budget billing process. 
This account balance is fraudulent and the XXXX balance was paid in full at the time I fires XXXX XXXX for their lack of service and contract discrepancies. I would like the Consumer Trade Commission to assist me in clearing this matter from my credit history. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a continuation of Complaint # XXXX which was closed prior to allowing the consumer to respond with additional information. 

The timeline : Select Portfolio Servicing, Inc. ( SPS ) XX/XX/2017 = Due to financial setbacks, we notified Select Portfolio Servicing , Inc. ( SPS ) we would be unable to cover payments by XXXX 2017 and initiated a Request for Mortgage Assistance with them. SPS recommended and *approved* us for a short sale based on our situation. Furthermore, SPS agreed *not* to report us to credit agencies as past due as long as we were in an active short sale process, which we were. 

XX/XX/2017 = SPS reported 30 days overdue to XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX ( we were still in the short sale process ) XX/XX/2017 = SPS reported 60 days overdue to XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX ( we were still in the short sale process ) XX/XX/2017 = SPS reported 90 days overdue to XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX ( we were still in the short sale process ) XX/XX/2017 = Short sale completed, SPS reported 120 days or no data to XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX ( we closed the short sale process and sold the property ) XX/XX/2017 = Account formally closed *We are not disputing any of the language on the short sale agreement. We're disputing that we did not receive the 120 days Marketing Period as spelled out on SPS 's own website. * We submitted our request for mortgage assistance/short sale to SPS in XXXX of 2017 in the attached Hardship Affidavit. In the meantime we lined up a buyer, and SPS dragged their feet to approve until XXXX of 2017, as noted in the Short Sale Agreement pdf attached. 

Since we gave them plenty of notice and were current with our payments, we were eligible for XXXX payments for a 120 day marketing period, as spelled out on the company 's own website here : https : //www.spservicing.comXXXX  ( Short Sale Overview - Select Portfolio Servicing ) A short sale enables you to sell your home for less than the total amount owed on the mortgage. If eligible, we would accept the short payoff in full satisfaction of the total amount due on the mortgage loan. 
www.spservicing.com ( under Payments During Marketing Period ) : " Eligible customers may be offered a ( {$0.00} ) XXXX dollar payment plan during the marketing period. SPS will not reject the customers payment if they chose to make their full contractual payment. The marketing period may last no less than one hundred twenty ( 120 ) calendar days, and extensions to the original term may be offered upon discretion of Management. The customer may be required to provide a listing agreement and evidence that property is actively listing for sale. " ****We were eligible, the buyer 's offer was in, and SPS assured us everything was in order. Despite this, they reported us overdue in XXXX ( the month we were approved ), XXXX, and XXXX of 2017 to XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. In essence, 0 marketing days instead of 120. ****

The monthly payment has not started yet ( will start from XX/XX/XXXX ) but they broke the contract already. I can not pay for the extra {$26000.00} dollars immediately. But if I return the car I need to pay {$1000.00} for the miles I drove these days ( just 200 miles ). This is absolutely a defraud and robbery. Assuming I have the money and paid for the extra down payment, what about after I drive for three months and they force me to fully pay for the car.
