Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer ; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. ( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft ; ( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed ; ( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section ; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block. ( c ) Authority to decline or rescind. ( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions. ( 2 ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title. ( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block. ( d ) Exception for resellers. ( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller ; ( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer ; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft. ( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information. ( 3 ) Notice. In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale. ( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negotiable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section 1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft. ( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify - through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract - any and all accounts you post on a credit report. Otherwise, anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. I demand to see Verifiable Proof ( an original Consumer Contract with my Signature on it ) you have on file of the accounts listed below. Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must remove the accounts listed below. I demand the following accounts be verified or removed immediately

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2019 XXXX XXXX XXXX This is the letter orginally sent to inform Equifax that I recently received a copy of my credit report and their company publishes and after reviewing it I found an item on the report that is inaccurate. The accounts in question are listed below. Please send me copies of the documents that you have in your files as of this date that you used to verify the accuracy of the accounts listed below. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681g I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all of the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of this request concerning the accounts that you are reporting in my credit report. Please dont respond to my request by saying that these accounts have been verified. Send me copies of the documents that you have in your files that were used to verify them. If you do not have any documentation in your files to verify the accuracy of these disputed accounts then please delete them immediately as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ). By  publishing these inaccurate and unverified items on my credit report and distributing them to 3rd parties you are damaging my reputation and credit worthiness. 
Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, all unverified accounts must be promptly deleted. Therefore, if you are unable to provide me with a copy of the verifiable proof that you have on file for each of the accounts listed below within 30 days of receipt of this letter then you must remove these accounts from my credit report. Please provide me with a copy of an updated and corrected credit report showing these items removed. 



I did not receive a response from Equifax although I did get a letter from XXXX XXXX stating that they will remove this account from my credit report, since this account has been deleted by XXXX XXXX so show the collection account listed under XXXX XXXX XXXX they are both the same account. Equifax is damaging my credit profile with this information which should of been removed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Good Morning I have had a CITI account since XXXX. 

I was erroneously enrolled in XXXX protection when I started my account. The actual charge went unnoticed by me since I have had my card. I received bills electronically and due to my own fault, never noticed it/ This year in XXXX I was going to pay off my CITI card and I contacted CITI for a fee. As I was talking to customer service, I asked about the fee that I suddenly noticed. I was informed that I must have signed up for it. I demanded it be canceled and I asked to be provided proof that I even signed up. They said I must have clicked the option or agreed to it. They put me through to XXXX   and was under the impression that I would receive a reimbursement. 30 days went by and I did not see a credit so I called again. I paid off all my bill in XXXX but what I thought they owed me back - approximately XXXX. They could not locate my request and submitted it again. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received the first denial from CITI. I was upset and called customer service again 3 - 4 days later. I said that I was cancelling my card and I was then transferred to a supervisor - XXXX. He lead me to believe that again, I would be reimbursed and I asked again for proof that I actually signed up. I also mentioned the letter that I received in XXXX that I was being refunded XXXX in fees due to a settlement with CFPB. I asked for proof it was credited. 30 days later - XX/XX/XXXX, I received a second denial letter. This time I gave very negative feedback and was contacted by another senior account specialist. He said I did receive the credit for XXXX. I told him that CITI behaved in a predatory manner. He basically didn't care and transferred me back to a XXXX member. I wish I had the name and date by my phone deleted the vmail call in an update as well as my notes. The individual was located in KY - I believe his name was XXXX. 

I spoke with XXXX  again the first week of XXXX. I explained that I was a XXXX vet, received XXXX and XXXX compensations. The XXXX representative ( again - I apologize but my phone updated and deleted my notes ) was resubmitting the information a third time because she said I most likely was not even eligible. I said I would have never signed up for protection from unemployment or whatever, because I received compensation that most do not receive. Again, after 30 days I have received a third denial letter dated XXXX XXXX.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Mr. XXXX XXXX CEO XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NC XXXX Mr. XXXX : Over the weekend, the attached letter and envelope was hand- delivered to me by someone who, mistakenly, opened it, after it was delivered to the address of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX SC XXXX. 

I do not live at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, SC XXXX. 

Inside the envelope was the attached letter, containing my bank account number. 

My security has been BREACHED by the carelessness, foolishness and neglect of your employees. How many other letters, containing my account information, has BB & T mailed to the wrong address? 

Furthermore, since the letter is not drafted on XXXX  letterhead, I do not take its statements seriously. 

The letter states my account will be closed, today. Obviously, this can not take place is it is in RETALIATION for my complaints about XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX failing to return telephone calls and attempting to charge me closing costs which I was told would be waived by your staff on the day that I opened my account. 

Effective, IMMEDIATELY, I am taking over as the XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX  for XXXX and will clean up this mess! You, and everyone else, report to me. Please prepare my new office inside your XXXX branch so that I can report to work Thursday, XX/XX/2020 at XXXX XXXX. EST. 

You are directed to keep my account open, in good standing, until further notice, Furthermore, you are directed to pay me the PENALTY FEES OF {$100.00} XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, to me, IMMEDIATELY, for BREACHING my security! These funds are to be, IMMEDIATELY, deposited into my account when this email is received! 

Many thanks! 




XXXX XXXX XXXX I wish I read all the one-star, negative reviews before I opened my account. So many negative reviews mean BB & T stands for Brainless Banking Trash, When I opened my account, I wasn't given a temporary debit card. ( Strike one ) I was about to refinance my home and asked the intake clerk if BB & T waived closing costs for current account holders. She said yes. Later, the loan people laughed at be for believing her and refused to waive the costs. ( Strike 2 ) Calls were also not returned. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!! When I called corporate to complain, they dragged their feet. ( Strike 3 ). But, wait, there's more! Corporate decided to close my account and sent the letter to the WRONG address where it was opened ( Revealing my ENTIRE ACCOUNT NUMBER TO A STRANGER! ) Fortunately, the stranger saw the CORRECT address on the actual letter and brought it to me. STILL, THIS IS A MAJOR SECURITY BREACH!!!!! Because it was the weekend, I had little recourse, and had to wait until Monday. when I tried to call the lady who signed the letter, THEY REFUSED TO LET ME SPEAK WITH HER!!!!! After waiting 32 minutes arguing and being put on hold, I hung up, called back, and was connected with XXXX who promised to give me 2 more weeks and call me back about my request for 30 days, XXXX never called back and I emailed corporate with a copy of the wrong address envelope and a substantial fine. The result? More retaliation. They had the branch manager XXXX XXXX, call to harass me to set an appointment to close the account. When I refused, they closed it without telling me! My mortgage payment hadn't cleared and the fraud department is stuck on " Let me call you, tomorrow ... ) If it wasn't for the hassle of changing accounts I would be thrilled to walk away from Brainless Banking Trash!!! 

Run, don't walk, from Brainless Banking Trash!!!!!

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Trouble with how payments are being handled
Consumer complaint narrative:
Issue 1 Response : We agree that you made a payment of {$260.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and that your due date was XX/XX/XXXX. However, no payment had been received in XX/XX/XXXX. Therefore, the payment received on XX/XX/XXXX needed to be credited toward satisfying the delinquent bill from XX/XX/XXXX. Because the XX/XX/XXXX payment was received more than 15 days after the XX/XX/XXXX due date, it did not count as a PSLF-qualifying payment. Therefore, no qualifying payments were counted for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
Response to Issue 1 : My previous loan servicer ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) is no longer in existence. When I try to login to prove my XX/XX/XXXX payment, the website is defunct. My bank also does not keep payment records from this far back. Its egregious that they wouldnt count the XX/XX/XXXX payment because they say I didnt pay my XXXX. Paying a XX/XX/XXXX bill on time, but saying its late because its the XXXX payment, is unacceptable. If I needed to pay both XXXX and XXXX to qualify for XXXX, they should have billed me that amount. I actually did this on XX/XX/XXXX, at the advice of XXXX XXXX XXXX, and paid {$520.00} ( 2 months worth ). 
Therefore, I request that XX/XX/XXXX be counted and the months worth of EXTRA payment I made on XX/XX/XXXX, at the advice of the loan servicer, be counted for XX/XX/XXXX as I was told. 

Issue 2 Response : Your Direct Consolidation Loan transferred to FedLoan Servicing on XX/XX/XXXX ( with an effective date of XX/XX/XXXX ). The financial history confirms that no payments were received from you in either XX/XX/XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX. Therefore, a delinquency existed on the account. To resolve the delinquency after the loan transfer period, FedLoan Servicing applied an Administrative Forbearance to the loan on XX/XX/XXXX. This forbearance status was approved retroactively from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX to cover the past-due bills. As a result, no qualifying payments were counted for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. FedLoan Servicing is unable to address any processing delays that may have occurred prior to its servicing period. 
Response to Issues 2 : XXXX XXXX XXXX transferred to FedLoan Servicing, which was completely outside of my control. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX sent me a notice saying my loans would be transferred and my bill would be XXXX until the loan transfer process was complete. FedLoan themselves say that the loans were officially transferred finally on XX/XX/XXXX. XXXX placed me in administrative forbearance without any choice on my part, and I had no way of even making XXXX or XX/XX/XXXX payments. Saying that they are unable to address any processing delays in unacceptable for people who are attempting to count every payment possible towards loan forgiveness. This was completely outside my control. 
Therefore, I request to have the ability to make retroactive payments for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 

( Issue 3 Resolved ) Issue 4 Response : On XX/XX/XXXX, you made an online payment of {$390.00}. However, for that month, the monthly installment was only {$350.00}. The payment entirely satisfied the XX/XX/XXXX bill and partially satisfied the XX/XX/XXXX. As a result, only a portion of the monthly installment ( {$320.00} ) remained due to satisfy the XX/XX/XXXX bill. You were notified of this amount, which you paid on XX/XX/XXXX. However, the full monthly installment amount ( {$350.00} ) still needed to be paid in order for the payment to count toward the PSLF program. Therefore, no qualifying payment was counted for XX/XX/XXXX. Regardless of the amount due on the monthly billing statement, please continue to remit the full monthly installment if you wish for it to be counted toward the PSLF program. 
Response to Issues 4 : My bank, XXXX XXXX, made automatic withdrawals ( which I signed up through my fed loan servicing ). FedLoan made a mistake when I called and said that my loan recalculation was off, which was why my payment was actually lower than my previous {$390.00}. Its unbelievable that I would pay exactly what my bill says ( and actually pay MORE the previous month due to the fault of Fedloan ) and get penalized for it. Fedloan should have billed me the correct amount, ESPECIALLY when I had automatic withdrawals FROM Fedloan. 
Therefore, I request that XX/XX/XXXX be overridden, and that I have the ability to pay the small difference it what they say I still owed for XX/XX/XXXX. 

Issue 5 Response : On XX/XX/XXXX, an electronic application was received. You requested the repayment schedule to be changed from the IBR plan to the Revised Pay As You Earn ( REPAYE ) plan. Within eight ( 8 ) business days, on XX/XX/XXXX, the process to remove the account from the IBR plan ( opt-out process ) was initiated. The IBR opt-out process, which was completed in accordance with federal regulations, requires the remittance of a payment under a Standard Repayment plan. If a borrower can not afford the installment under the Standard Repayment plan, then a Reduced Payment Forbearance may be selected. This forbearance option allows a borrower to make a lower payment in order to exit the IBR plan and to change to a different repayment schedule. 
Response to Issue 5 : Taking three months to review someones loan information, especially when they are applying for loan forgiveness, is unacceptable and denies me due process. They even said I made the required {$280.00} reduced payment ) on XX/XX/XXXX. 
Therefore, I request that XX/XX/XXXX be overridden and be counted towards my qualifying loan payments, and that I have the ability to override and pay for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative: PNC Bank started charging me a $ XXXX monthly maintenance fee for my Performance Select checking account in XX/XX/XXXX without clearly notifying me. I did not notice the recurring fee until XX/XX/XXXX, at which point I had unknowingly spent {$270.00} in fees. I called on XX/XX/XXXX to complain and spoke with XXXX and she said they would refund ( only ) two months of fees ( {$50.00} ). PNC Bank should be required to clearly and repeatedly explicitly notify customers when their account balance falls to a point where they begin charging maintenance fees. If an account falls below the required balance threshold to maintain a free performance select checking account, PNC bank should reduce the account tier instead of charging a maintenance fee to maintain a preferred account.

We feel this isn't a fair lending practice by mosaic loans. 


Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Product: Prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX XXXX, 2016 I was reviewing my account online and noticed five fraudulent transactions and five attempted fraudulent transactions that were declined on my account. I immediately called US Money XXXX to let them know of the fraudulent transactions on my account. They said they noticed the attempts on my account and they said they froze the account so no more transactions could occur. When I asked them if they froze my account on XXXX XXXX how could seven more transactions occur from XXXX XXXX thru XXXX XXXX. There was silence on the phone and they could not give me an answer. I immediately went back on line to print my account transactions and was not able to. I called back to US Money XXXX to ask how come I did not have access to my account and they said the account was frozen on XXXX XXXX not on XXXX XXXX as the representative told me. At that time, I asked for a replacement card and they told me a replacement card would cost {$40.00}. I asked why and they said that was to expedite the card. I told them to send it regular mail so there would be no extra charge. I also asked at that time if they could send me a dispute form and a complete statement of all of my XXXX transactions. They said they would email it to me within XXXX hours. It took three phone calls and two emails to finally get the dispute forms and I still have not received a complete XXXX statement. I called them back after seven business days to let them know that I have not received a replacement card. The representative told me that the card was returned to them with an incorrect address. I do n't understand how this could occur since I always receive statements and checks from them. She told me that she would resend the card and I should receive it within five to seven days. When the end of XXXX came, I called again to let them know that I still do not have a replacement card and would like a card to get access to my remaining funds. On XXXX XXXX, I called and let them know that I still do not have a replacement card. They received my dispute forms with the police report I filed on XXXX XXXX. On XXXX XXXX they sent me a response letter stating that they were unable to assist in the recovery of these funds because they claim that the transactions were made face to face and the card was present. They also said that since I failed to contact customer service until four days after the transactions that my claim was not eligible for reimbursement. I called US Money XXXX again and asked for copies of all of the fraudulent transactions and was told that I would have them in twenty four hours via email. Still as of today, I have not received a replacement card, can not access my funds and I have not been reimbursed the {$220.00} of the fraudulent transactions. They did credit my account {$5.00} in fees on the attempted fraudulent transactions. All of these transactions were not face to face and they were all on line transactions. I tried calling US Money XXXX parent company, Check Into Cash, to see if they could assist me and so far I have had no response. Several things about this do not make sense. They claim all transactions were face to face with card present and as you can see they were internet transactions. I reside in South Carolina and have possession of the card and the fraudulent transactions took place in New York. I do not understand how come they will not send me a replacement card so I can access my funds and do not understand why they will not send me any supporting documents. They seem to want to help me until they ask me if I still work for Check Into Cash. I tell them no and then they get abrupt and cold with me. I worked for Check Into Cash for three years and I do not know why that every time I called them they asked this question " Do you still work for Check Into Cash ''? I have never received a text alert in 31/2 yrs

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I processed a payment to XXXX using the CASHAPP prepaid debit card and subsequent available funds in my CASHAPP account. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I was advised by XXXX that the reservation I attempted to make was no longer available and the hold placed on the funds for said reservation would be released. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I attempted to contact CASHAPP to have the amount of {$480.00} released back to me and provided them the case ID from XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received correspondence from XXXX advising that they could not use the case ID as a means to release the payment but if I was able to secure an email from XXXX stating the payment was to be released, they would do so immediately. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, after spending a few hours on the phone I was able to secure said email from XXXX and sent it over to XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received an email from XXXX stating that they could not see the transaction and that I needed to screenshot it from my phone for them to see the dollar amount. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I responded with the screenshot requested showing the amount. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I received a response from XXXX stating that they could not use the information I provided to affect the refund and that any issues should be referred to XXXX. I responded pointing out the obvious fact that the information provided was the exact information they stated they needed and at no time did they claim that any of the provided documents ( upon receipt ) would not suffice. Furthermore, despite articulations that the information would not suffice they gave no remedies or instructions on what would suffice. They essentially decided to simply ignore the documentation provided ( that they requested ) and move to deny providing the refund. 

At this point, any financial vehicle with unregulated access to funds should be held accountable when it shows to be operating in poor faith. The question is not only why they do not affect this refund but ; 1 ) where is the money 2 ) who is gaining interests on the capital 3 ) is this money being reported as income to the IRS?

4 ) where is this money being held?

5 ) who enforces standards against predatory financial instruments 6 ) if I do not receive my refund, is that considered a loss and as such can I seek to strike that as income from my income taxes?

7 ) when this type of behavior causes financial hardships, is CASHAPP responsible for any subsequent financial harm caused by their poor stewardship.

9 ) should business such as this be allowed to operate or have access to standardize institutions when this type of behavior in large scale could cause widespread economic harm? 

These are questions that should be asked by not only regulatory agencies but lawmakers as well. In this time of economic hardships, they Gov us a fiduciary responsibility to ensure these type of operations are not allowed to continue and remained unchecked. 

For me, it was only {$490.00}. For the less fortunate or those who can not access traditional banking options, it could be their lifes savings.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or around XX/XX/2019, I deposited $ 5000+ into a BMO Harris account that had a {$500.00} incentive offer associated with it. At the time I was in the branch office in XXXX XXXX in XXXX, FL, there was a concern I had that the incentive offer was based on the wording that the money be deposited the same day as the account was opened. I brought this to the attention of XXXX, the branch manager there, and she assured me that if there was any problem because of that, she would take care of it. I just spoke with her today ( XX/XX/2019 ), more than 6 months after I opened the account, and she is wrongly telling me that I was supposed to do a wire transfer the next day. I told her that is not what her and I agreed on which was a bank to bank transfer. If what she was saying was true ( which is it not ), then she should have contacted me 2 business days later if she did not see the money and told me I was disqualified. However, I am 100 % certain that she knew and agreed to the bank to bank transfer, which can sometimes take 6 to 8 business days, which can amount to as much as 12 calendar days in some cases. 

It appears to me they are trying to look for false excuses to not pay me, even though I was assured I should be fine. I asked at least once for XXXX to give me written confirmation of her word but she never sent it to me, making me think she was trying to " XXXX me over '' all along. She claims she is trying to escalate it up the chain of command, but the agreement was that SHE would take care of any problems, not the higher ups. She appears to be looking for ways not to pay me the {$500.00} but the agreement was made and I met all of the requirements ( with the exception of the same day deposit but that requirement was verbally waived by XXXX ). 

I am requesting that if they say they told me I had to pay via wire transfer only, that they show written proof of that. If they can not, then they can not prove that is what they told me. My very clear recollection is that I told them I would be doing a bank to bank transfer and have to wait to go through the security procedures for doing that and they agreed. I gave them the example " Do you expect people to just walk in this bank with {$5000.00} cash in their pocket? That seems unreasonable ''. They agreed to that statement and told me a bank to bank transfer is fine and reasonable. 

They are telling me on the phone that because it took 11 days to deposit the money that it was " too long '' but they never told me any time limit to do the bank to bank transfer. They mentioned 10 days which is very suspicious because it is 1 day less than what I may have taken. Since I am at the mercy of the bank funding the bank to bank transfer ( and somewhat at the mercy of the receiving bank too ), I should not be penalized for taking 11 days to transfer the money. I remember I had a few challenges to get that transfer to work so it was not simple like just pushing a button. 

BMO Harris should be reprimanded for doing this to me. If they " knew '' I would not qualify, they should have let me know early so I could have taken my money out and invested in elsewhere. However since I feel I met ALL the requirements, I am holding them to the {$500.00} and if they do not pay, I am prepared to contact the local news and report them to warn other people NOT to bank at BMO Harris and possibly even sue them in small claims court. I had a similar problem with another bank ( XXXX XXXX ) but  I " fought '' them and they paid. I am prepared to " fight '' again with this bank that is XXXX me around bigtime. 

Thank you.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received by email a promotional offer from Bank of America ( attached to this complaint ). The offer states that if I open a Bank of America Advantage bank account by XX/XX/XXXX and set up direct deposits totaling {$4000.00} or more within 90 days of opening the account, Bank of America would deposit a {$300.00} reward in my account within 60 days. There was also some fine print, which I have read and none of which disqualifies me from the offer. 

In response to the offer, I opened and funded a Bank of America Advantage SafeBalance Banking  Account on XX/XX/XXXX, and set up direct deposit. I then received direct deposits of {$3500.00} each into the account on XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. Combined, these of course exceed the {$4000.00} required to qualify for the promotional offer, so I expected to receive the {$300.00} deposit from Bank of America within 60 days. However, by XX/XX/XXXX, I had not received the {$300.00} deposit. That day, I called the company about the missing deposit and spoke with XXXX from South Carolina, who told me that my inquiry had been escalated to the sales department and they would take up to 30 days to investigate. ( I'm not sure what would take so long, since the promotional email takes only minutes to read, as does verifying that I had met the requirements. ) As of today, 40 days have passed and I have heard nothing more from Bank of America, nor has the {$300.00} been deposited in my account. The company has not held up their end of the deal they advertised. 

My complaint today is about the above, but it's worth mentioning that this is not an isolated incident. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a similar promotional email offer from the company. That offer invited me to open a qualifying account by XX/XX/XXXX, and make two qualifying direct deposits of {$250.00} or more within 90 days of opening the account, after which the company promised to deposit {$100.00} within 60 days. I met all the requirements by XX/XX/XXXX, and yet the company did not deposit the {$100.00} within the promised timeframe. I had to call the company numerous times and even make a physical visit to a branch before the company finally made the deposit they had advertised in the promotional email inXX/XX/XXXX. They were delinquent by more than five months on the timeframe they advertised. ( Note that thisXX/XX/XXXX account does not disqualify me from the XXXX promotion because I closed that account in XXXX and was not a signer or owner of a Bank of America personal checking account between then and XX/XX/XXXX. ) It appears to me that the company 's strategy may be to entice potential customers with promotional offers that they do not intend to honor, and to drag their feet when customers inquire in hopes that the customer will forget about the promise or be too busy to pursue the matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have a balance at my previous school which is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX -XXXX XXXX ( which is already closed ) so they forward my remaining balance at this company ( William & Fudge ) since then, I have been paying my balance and I am almost done paying everything off. I believe my balance before this problem with them started was around $ 950.which I usually pay it online. However, that time they change the payment and started charging debit cards use so I called them ( XX/XX/2019 ) and see how can I way without paying extra. A representative named XXXX XXXX spoke to me and I thought she can help me with my problem. She told me that theres no way I can pay my balance without paying the transaction fee from the card unless I use check. Which needs to have routing number and account number but it will take 10 business days to clear it up. Since I forgot that they never charge for late fee I told her that okay for now Ill pay with my debit and pay that transaction fee but after she ran my card without confirming that she will run it. Thats where I remember that I dont get charge for late fees. So I told her I change my mind but since she processed the payment already let it go. Then I told her that I will go online instead to do the automatic payment. She told me it will not work and I have to do the process with her and she keep insisting to call me the following month. Even though I told her no but she still keep Insisting and I end up telling okay whatever. That same day I fill up online to do the automatic payment and it went through. I was expecting she will call me a month after as what she told me.but instead, she called me the beginning of the month of XXXX and keeps on calling me Leaving me a message. Some of them has an actually message and some has nothing or she will be singing and leave a message and continue singing/humming. One day, I accidentally answered her call and call me out as if I am not going to pay them ( which I already did ) shes already giving me an attitude and harassing me so I told her that I am not going to talk to her and I want to speak to her supervisor. After the back and fort argument she finally give it to her supervisor name XXXX XXXX ( I  think ) and he was trying to resolve the problem with me and found out that I did made the payment already so tried offering me some discount with the balance and try to make the payment split in 2 payment. However, I told him that I cant afford to make just 2 sets of payments but I am still willing to pay the monthly with the same amount or a little but more. As long as no one will contact or harass me especially That XXXX XXXX and he told that he will talk to her. Then then today, I received an email from her. Telling me that she will send a negative in my credit report if I dont pay my balance which I have been paying as what I told her supervisor. Now, I have been trying to call them and since I am in different place right now I am having a hard time calling them. I just want to make that she will not harass anyone anymore and threatened them about their credit report.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
USAA FEDERAL SAVINGS BANK XXXX XXXX XXXX CEO XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX OHXXXX Date : XX/XX/2019 RE :  CONDITIONAL ACCEPTANCE FOR VALUE FOR PROOF OF CLAIM UPON CORPORATIONS CONTRACT, FOR DETERMINATION OF MEETING OF THE MINDS, FRAUD ON THE CONTRACT, AND/OR AN UNCONSCIONABLE CONTRACT AND/OR AGREEMENT FOR COMMERCIAL DISCHARGE Mortgage Loan # XXXX Instrument # XXXX Book 524 Page 331. 
Public Notice To : XXXX XXXX Dear Mr. XXXX XXXX/ Senior Supervisor, USAA Federal Savings Bank is the Lender described in Definition D, of the Security Instrument Title MORTGAGE upon which ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) is the borrower described in Definition B. This MORTGAGE has been sealed, delivered and recorded by the borrower in Book 524 Page 331 at XXXX County Recorders Office and as of today has not been acknowledged by the lender, You ( XXXX XXXX ) therefore have 15 days to execute and record your acknowledgment of said MORTGAGE, or you ( XXXX XXXX ) are in breach of contract and transgressing Gods Law. As this instrument is already public record and full proof of evidence which has been recorded by XXXX County Recorders Office. 

As the MORTGAGE is a Security instrument, I also ask for a certified copy of the lawfully recorded Lien that this MORTGAGE is a Security instrument for to be mailed along with certified copy of your recorded acknowledgement of the MORTGAGE to my mailing address provided above. If a lien is not recorded delivered nor noticed then it is a statutory lien. Statutory liens have been ruled unconstitutional by the U.S. Supreme Court in XXXX XXXX XXXX being 171 US 404. Without a lawful recorded lien, the Security Instrument is a false obligation, a breach of good faith, and a sin to compel my performance. 

If copies of the recorded lien and your acknowledgement ( Signature ) of the MORTGAGE are not delivered within 15 days then as Grantor of the MORTGAGE. I revoke it, and demand that my securities and or their conversion and gain be returned to me Immediately. This includes the title to the real property, as well as the value of the personal property and Satisfaction/release of MORTGAGE. 

If necessary to compel you ( XXXX XXXX ) to conduct your business in good faith as I will petition the Bishop of this Diocese as the Judge of the first instance for his assistance in gaining the return of my property and to inquire into the business practice of your corporation, he having exclusive Jurisdiction over faith, sin, law of contracts, oaths, investments under notary seal and the like. I am sure you ( XXXX XXXX ) are aware that the XXXX XXXX and its Courts have jurisdiction over the entire world. 

Ive come to you ( XXXX XXXX ) first to settle the matter and ask you ( XXXX XXXX ) let your conscience be your guide, adhere to your oath, and operate in good faith. Failure to do so could be construed as heresy an eternal XXXX for your soul. Fear XXXX. 

Mail your acknowledgement of the MORTGAGE and certified copy under oath of the recorded lien ; Title to the real property and any conversion and gain of the personal property to My address. 

In Closing, your ability in this matter to operate in the unconscious world is terminated, and you are personally responsible and bound by oath for the actions of the corporation you represent. 

I XXXX XXXX XXXX Testify to this statement of Facts. As to Witnesses to the Facts by Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and XXXX County Recorder 's office.

I received a letter on XX/XX/XXXX that my dispute was denied for the amount of {$99.00}. 

The gym membership was canceled on XX/XX/XXXX - the contract required 30-day notice of cancelation. The gym contract should have been canceled on XX/XX/XXXX a day prior before dues were taken out. That was not the case.

Product: Credit card or prepaid card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Credit card company won't increase or decrease your credit limit
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received my American Express card in XXXX. The available credit was for {$10000.00}. After using it for just a few months they increased my limit to XXXX. In XXXX I had the balance on that card up to almost the full limit. A few months later I made a large payment bringing the balance down to about 40 %. Nothing changed on my account. 
By the summer of XXXX I was suddenly informed that my credit limit was cut down to XXXX, leaving me only a mere XXXX in available credit. 
I appealed that decision and my appeal was denied. 
After this occurred I paid off the card and limited my transactions on it. 
KEEP IN MIND : I NEVER missed a payment nor made a late payment. Not one in all the time Ive had the card. 
Ive always paid more than the minimum, but none of that was considered in their decision. 
Now fast forward to today. Just 6 months later, they have cut my limit AGAIN. Bringing my available credit from {$8300.00} to only {$1000.00}. 
They cut my limit by {$4700.00} the first time and now theyve cut it by another {$7300.00}. 
In only a 6 month period they took away {$12000.00} in available credit. 
My credit score took a huge hit the first time this happened and Im sure will take an even bigger hit this time since it hasnt even recovered from the last decrease. 
When youre in a situation like this your back is against the wall. You are totally at the mercy of the creditor. And that is unfathomably unfair. No one can help you and AMEX does not care about the type of custumer YOU have been to them. 
There is no loyalty to their customers. I did everything right and I was still put in this position. 
I paid on time, paid more than the minimum, and maintained a low balance on the card. 
NONE of that was taken into consideration when making this decision. They went solely based on the other activity on my credit report which should be considered only SECONDARY to the way Ive maintained business with them. That is not the case. 
The appeal process is all you have and all they want to see is proof of income. Something that WASNT even required when opening the account! 
So anything on my credit report that resulted in their decision to decrease my balance then becomes irrelevant if my income is enough?! Thats a very backwards philosophy. 
What AMEX does NOT consider when making these decisions is the affect it has on the overall credit utilization of the consumer and how decreasing the available credit by that much, that quickly, is catastrophic to a consumers credit report. 
Decisions like this should be thoroughly considered and CAREFULLY looked into before they occur. 
I had no drastic changes in my credit report, my income has not changed and even if my utilization was higher than normal, all of my accounts are current and paid on time. Those should be the biggest factors considered when deciding to decrease a consumers available credit. 
Cutting a consumers credit limit by {$12000.00} in less than a year is unacceptable. And for that I am extremely disappointed with the way American Express has decided to conduct business with their customers.

Consumer complaint narrative: In XX/XX/XXXX I received an auto loan from Credit Acceptance Corporation. Throughout the lifetime of the loan, I experienced numerous inaccuracies reported by Credit Acceptance on my credit report. Some of the inaccuracies were corrected after having to jump through hoops with Credit Acceptance Directly, yet  additional inaccuracies continued to show up on my reports. Currently, I am in the process of purchasing a house and am reviewing the negative accounts on my credit reports and Credit Acceptance is one of them. After looking into the payment history, I realized that Credit Acceptance has multiple 30, 60, 90 day  late payments on my account, including listing the account as late when closed ( which is impossible if the account was paid in full ). There was only one time that I was late on my loan with Credit Acceptance and that was in XX/XX/XXXX. I have tried to call CAC directly to correct the errors and their customer service team has refused to acknowledge that I ever had an account with them.

Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2020 XXXX and XXXX XXXX Loan number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, NY XXXX Good morning, We're reaching out to you, this morning, to bring to your attention the questionable behavior of Bayview home loans, as well as their attorneys, XXXX XXXX. 

My husband and I have been working with Bayview Home Loans since XXXX, attempting to negotiate a Forbearance Plan. We submitted a complete request package on XX/XX/XXXX and shortly thereafter were notified, via mail, by XXXX XXXX that there is a pending hearing scheduled for XX/XX/XXXX. 

Not only does Bayview have no record of REQUESTING this hearing, they have no record on file of the hearing date scheduled or of giving XXXX XXXX permission to schedule it. We've spoken to Bayview on three separate times regarding this matter - XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. On each of those conversations, Bayview Home Loans confirmed for us that there was NO HEARING SCHEDULED and they had NOT GIVEN permission to XXXX XXXX to do so. 

We're extremely concerned about this situation, given that we can't get a straight answer from either organization and we're asking that you step in and request that this hearing be immediately put on hold. 

Once again, we are actively engaged in negotiations with Bayview Home Loans - given that, under federal guidelines, no legal action can take place until the determination of our request is completed. 

I can be reached at XXXX anytime. Thank you for your assistance with this, XXXX XXXX
Company: Community Loan Servicing, LLC (formerly known as Bayview Loan Servicing, LLC)

Product: Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting, credit repair services, or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Weve been in their program for 14 months ( since XX/XX/2018 ), and they have not honored A SINGLE THING present on both our contract with them or the terms of several recorded conversations we had with one of their sales managers, XXXX XXXX, since the day she sold us this atrocious program. 

We had good credit, just a lot of revolving credit card debt. She sold us ( we have the agreements and multiple recorded phone conversations to prove ) AN APPROVED ZERO INTEREST LOAN THAT SHOULDVE AUTOMATICALLY KICKED IN AFTER 12 MONTHS OF MAKING PAYMENTS IN THEIR PROGRAM AND USED TO PAY OUR DEBT IN FULL AND GET OUR CREDIT SCORE BETTER THAN WHEN WE STARTED THE PROGRAM Instead, after 13 months, we were contacted by a 3rd Party Company named Credit 9 who basically told us, ON A RECORDED LINE, that even though those were not the terms of our agreement with Americor, that is all we had available to us.

To add insult to injury, after 6 weeks of back and forth and making us reapply for a supposedly no interest loan we were already approved for ( having agreements and multiple recorded phone calls from different employees means absolutely nothing to these people ), we were finally offered a new loan agreement with the caveat of paying them 22.50 % APR because they did nothing but destroy our name and credit in the last 13 months and now we can not get a proper loan from anyone else. 

Complete scam ( classic bait and switch ) and now we are basically stuck with ruined credit and the option of either paying them this outrageous interest or leave the program in our current state of affairs. 

After a XXXX complaint and multiple reviews left in several different sites, XXXX XXXX from upper management finally decided to properly investigate. After listening to all phone conversations and reviewing all documents, although he did confirm she lied on a recorded line and completely screwed us over, all they were willing to do is fire her ( which they had already done ) and then tell us to either take the 22.5 % loan or leave the program with our credit ruined, obviously him being fully aware that a lawsuit will cost us a lot more then it will them at least until the case was judged. 

Now considering their actions and how they were advertising a zero interest loan ( this week they changed it to 5.99 % ) that is not at all zero or lie interest ( they count the 12 months you make deposits into the program without getting a single penny from them as well as not really being approved for anything as the zero interest period  XXXX sold us ). 

Considering that if you dont take a loan you do not pay any interest anyway and they are advertising and selling customers fraudulent zero/low interest loans, all that was left to do is file a complaint with the FTC and now here, not for their false advertising and extremely fraudulent actions, but all the damage they have caused us, Hopefully we will be able to eventually retain a lawyer who will agree filing a lawsuit against this company of miscreants on a contingency fee basis. 

Once they completely ruin your name and your credit, make you live for 12+ months without any credit cards, finally painting you into a corner where you have no choice but to sign their new loan with exorbitant interest rates, not only it is that much harder for you to pay for good legal representation, it is almost impossible to hold them accountable for their actions ( being the main reasons why they are able to continually pull this scam on people ).
